properties.name: BF/023
properties.notes: The site forms part of the Faversham Creek Neighbourhood Plan and its inclusion for a Permission in Principle could undermine this process.. The site comprises four buildings formerly used by the Frank and Whitorne Joinery Company and is adjacent to Faversham creek.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BF/136
properties.notes: The site forms part of the Queenborough & Rushenden Masterplan and its inclusion for a Permission in Principle could undermine this process.. The site comprises a former foundry and is open, flat and adjacent to Queenborough Creek.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BF/167
properties.notes: The site has an application currently pending consideration.. Outline (All Matters Reserved) for up to 70 residential units and detailed approval for associated land raising and improvement of A2/Lydbrook Close junction.. The site comprises the former Nicholls Transport depot which has now been vacant for a number of years and is surrounded by dwellings close to the A2.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Former Nicholls Transport site, Lydbrook Close, Sittingbourne

properties.name: BF/237
properties.notes: The site is allcoated within the adopted Local Plan.. The site comprises a flat piece of land within a predominantly residential area, with some commercial/industrial use too. It is adjacent to the railway line to the north.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BF/256
properties.notes: The site forms part of the Queenborough & Rushenden Masterplan and its inclusion for a Permission in Principle could undermine this process.. The site comrises land including business offices, dockyard buildings and wharfs adjacent to Queenborough Creek.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BF/257
properties.notes: The site was recently granted planning permission and works are expected to commence imminently.. Development of the site to provide 105 residential units, comprising 72 houses and 33 flats, and associated, parking, landscaping and open space.. The site comprises a former industrial site which had a number of warehouse/office buildings. The site is bounded by Graveney Road, the wider countryside and a railway line.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Faversham Industrial Estate, Graveney Road, Faversham

properties.name: BF/258
properties.notes: The site forms part of the Queenborough & Rushenden Masterplan and its inclusion for a Permission in Principle could undermine this process.. The site is mostly vacant but with some industrial units and buildings still in use. It is surrounded by Rushenden Road to the east and Queenborough Creek to the west.
properties.site-address: Land West of Rushenden Road, Queenborough

properties.name: BF/259
properties.notes: The overall site is identified as having capacity for up to 650 dwellings, however a large part of the site was granted planning permission for 383 dwellings in May 2018 which are now under construction. The remainder of the site forms part of a detailed Local Plan allocation and its inclusion for a Permission in Principle could undermine this process.. The site comprises a cleared former industrial estate. It is surrounded by Milton Creek, Eurolink Way, Eurolink industrial estate and Sittingbourne retail park.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BF/265
properties.notes: The site has an application currently pending consideration.. Proposed mixed use development comprising 165 no. residential apartments, medical centre and pharmacy across three blocks with associated parking and landscaping, refurbishment of existing Bell House with retention of offices and an additional storey.. The site comprises the former Bell Shopping Centre which was demolished a number of years ago. The land has been vacant since and fronts Bell Road close to Sittingbourne town centre.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

properties.name: BF/275
properties.notes: The site forms part of the Faversham Creek Neighbourhood Plan and its inclusion for a Permission in Principle could undermine this process.. The site sits between Faversham Creek and New Creek Road and contains a number of designated heritage assets.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Provender Mill, New Creek Road, Faversham

properties.name: BF/281
properties.notes: The site forms part of the Queenborough & Rushenden Masterplan and its inclusion for a Permission in Principle could undermine this process.. The site lies to the south of Queenborough Creek and falls partly within the Queenborough Conservation Area, with a number of designated heritage assets close by.
properties.site-address: Land South of Queenborough Creek, Queenborough

properties.name: BF/283
properties.notes: The site has an application currently pending consideration.. Outline application for demolition of existing warehouse and office building and erection of 52 new dwellings with matters of access and scale to be considered as this stage.. The comprises a number of commercial premises and is generally flat with a change in level to Staplehurst Road to the east.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Former McDonald's Mailing Centre, Staplehurst Road, Sittingbourne

properties.name: BF/373
properties.notes: The site forms part of the Queenborough & Rushenden Masterplan and its inclusion for a Permission in Principle could undermine this process. An application is expected soon following an EIA Screening Opinion.. The site is a former steel rolling mill site and most of the associated structures have been demolished with hardstanding and vegetation remaining. Access is taken from Thomsett Way to the South.
properties.site-address: Former Istil Mill Site, Rushenden Road, Queenborough

properties.name: BF/505
properties.notes: The site was recently granted planning permission and works are expected to commence imminently.. Demolition of existing buildings and erection of 6 detached, two storey dwellings with associated access, parking and landscaped areas.. The site comprises a number of mobile buildings, a small workshop, a large workshop and a yard area. The land is set back from the main road and surrounded by agricultural land.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: High Oak Hill, Iwade Road, Newington

properties.name: BF/508
properties.notes: The site was granted planning permission in 2016.. Redevelopment of existing landscape contractor's yard and land surrounding Kent Terrace to provide 13 dwelling houses and an extension to the existing terrace with associated car parking and landscaping. In addition, a ground floor rear extension to Number 15 Kent Terrace.. The site comprises a landscape and horticultural contractor's yard which includes the access onto Canterbury Lane and follows down to the front of the terraced properties on Kent Terrace.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Land at Kent Terrace, Canterbury Lane, Upchurch

properties.name: BF/511
properties.notes: The site was granted planning permission in 2015.. Demolition of existing commercial buildings, removal of the existing hard surface areas and the erection of 5 no dwellings with amenity space, paddocks, parking, access and landscaping as amended by drawings received 1st June 2015.. The site comprises a number of buildings formerly used for commercial purposes. It is set back from Grove Road and generally well screened.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
properties.site-address: Moons of Selling, Grove Road, Selling

properties.name: BF/588
properties.notes: The site has an application currently pending decision.. Demolition of existing buildings. Outline application for the erection of 42 dwellings, with all matters reserved for future consideration.. The site comprises a recently vacatged industrial site opposite Howt Green Farm and close to a small ribbon of development.
properties.ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
